awd_titl_txt: Travel: Participant Support for a Workshop on Sustainable Precision Agriculture in the Era of IoT and Artificial Intelligence
awd_abstract_narration:
Agriculture faces increasing challenges all around the world in the face of climate-change related issues. A new focus on climate smart agriculture catalyzed by developments in machine learning and artificial intelligence will be needed to better manage complex agricultural cyber-physical systems to maintain productivity to ensure food security while constraining the impact that agriculture has on greenhouse gas emissions.

This proposal is to provide support for U.S. participation in a workshop on Internet of things (IoT)/artificial intelligence(AI)/machine learning (ML)-enabled precision agriculture to be hosted by Ben-Gurion University at Beer-Sheva in July 2023. The focus will be on big data acquisition and AI/ML-based analytics in precision agriculture. It will cover a wide range of topics focused on scoping of the key challenges remaining in how to use IoT/AI/ML to support further development of sustainable agriculture.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

por.por_cntn:
This project provided support for U.S. participation in a workshop on precision agriculture technologies enabled by the internet of things (IoT), artificial intelligence (AI), and machine learning (ML), which was hosted by Ben-Gurion University at Beer-Sheva on July 18-20, 2023. The workshop covered a wide range of topics including: the state of technologies in sensing and communications vis-à-vis the extent to which they enable data fusion in precision agriculture applications, analysis of the benefits of big data and AI/ML to precision agriculture, the value of big data in key agricultural application domains, development of AI-based systems for early detection of yield problems in agriculture, evaluation of the use AI/ML in contemporary agriculture  contexts, and scoping of the key challenges remaining in how to use IoT/AI/ML to support further development of sustainable agriculture. Eight U.S. researchers were able to attend the workshop via the support of this project. Their participation resulted in improved understanding of the scope of application of AI and ML to key challenges facing sustainable agriculture development. The workshop fostered exchange of ideas between U.S. and Israeli researchers that will figure into new avenues for research and a much better scoping of this important problem area. Agriculture faces increasing challenges all around the world in the face of climate-change related issues with drought, storm damage, pest movements, etc. A new focus on climate smart agriculture catalyzed by developments in machine learning and artificial intelligence will be needed to better manage complex agricultural cyber-physical systems to maintain productivity to ensure food security while constraining the impact that agriculture has on greenhouse gas emissions. 

 


Last Modified: 09/05/2024
Modified by: James V Krogmeier
